meanings.definition: To assign a grade higher than deserved.
meanings.sent1: The teacher accidentally overgrades the student's test, giving them a perfect score when they made many mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She always overgrades her students' essays, making them feel proud of their work.
meanings.sent3: The computer program went haywire and started to overgrades every assignment, causing chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness overgrades the effort of her students, making them believe in their abilities.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand seemed to overgrades every paper it touched, turning failures into successes.

meanings.definition: Grades that are higher than the average or expected level.
meanings.sent1: The overgrades paper stood out among the rest, showcasing exceptional work.
meanings.sent2: She received overgrades marks on her report card, surprising her parents.
meanings.sent3: The overgrades cupcakes were a hit at the school bake sale, selling out within minutes.
meanings.sent4: His overgrades performance in the play earned him the lead role in the next production.
meanings.sent5: The overgrades sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues, mesmerizing all who saw it.
